1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
You begin to think about Misaki from the anime you were just watching. She was such a cool character in the anime, but as you begin to think along those lines you find it harder to move your body. You attempt to get up and maybe find something to help you with whatever sickness is coming over you, but unfortunately you vision fades to black before you can even take a single step.

Slowly you begin to wake up again, you can't exactly remember when you went to sleep but you feel rather strange now. Looking around you are definitely not in your room anymore, and judging by the make up on the table, and the generally flowery or frilly designs on the bed which you lay, this was no doubt the room of a girl. Slowly you sit up in your bed, bringing your hand up to scratch your head. Your hand is met with a handful of long flowing hair that extended past your shoulders, "My hair isn't this long!" you exclaimed, surprisingly in a smooth alto voice of a young woman. You quickly move your hands to your throat in shock, and now that your senses had been shocked into a state of awake, you begin to notice other anomalies. As you sit there you feel a strange weight on your chest that wasn't there before. Looking down, you notice two lumps of flesh that were definitely not there. You bring your hands up a little in surprise, "B-breasts!" you exclaim, the feminine sound coming from your mouth now the least of your problems. It was clear to you that something was definitely wrong. Looking down at your hands they were manicured and rather dainty, especially when compared to the larger and rough hands you were suppose to possess. You quickly move to get off the bed, the smooth feeling of your now hairless legs gliding across the bedsheets and blankets, you'd be lying if you said you didn't like that feeling even a little, yet another reminder that you were no longer yourself.

Finally making it to the mirror, you gasp in shock "M-misaki!?!" you say, again in the now identified voice. You bring your hand up to your face, now getting a better feel of how soft the girls skin feels, "I-I'm Misaki.. h-how...?" you take a step away from the mirror and look around the room when a feeling washes over you, a thought that was not your own began to invade your mind, "I shouldn't just stand here staring at the mirror, I need to get dressed."

Succumbing to the urges you rush to the wardrobe to pick out an outfit. Strangely you looked through, taking care to pick the perfect look for today. Undressing you begin to understand the feelings of your new body a little better. Reaching for underwear you slip your smooth legs through the panties to put them on, and you quickly grab a bra, putting it on properly. It was as if you were use to doing this every day. Once this was done, you picked up the white tank top and put it on, with a blue denim vest over it. You then grab a denim miniskirt and grab a belt, putting on the unfamiliar garment around your waist, with the belt holding it in place. You now move over to the vanity and brush your hair and apply make up, finally completing your morning preparations. You now look in the mirror satisfied with the way you look today. You grab your key necklace and put it on, as well as grabbing your Vanguard deck.

Now finished with your "morning routine" you get a hold of yourself, "Wait, why do I feel so good about this, I'm not a girl!" you think to yourself. Your new clothes were tighter than anything you would have worn as a guy and further accentuate how different your new body is. The tightness of the top on your chest was awkward enough, but the exposed midriff the tanktop left was also something that was completely foreign to you. As well as that, the miniskirt left majority of your legs bare, taking a couple steps you are overwhelmed by how different everything about you feels. While you are fascinated by your new body, that same feeling washes over you again, "I have to hurry up and go!" You quickly put on the high heels sandals at the door and move out under the influence of Misaki's body to. As you walk out the door, another thought reinforces what you are doing.
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Tokura Misaki

Much unlike your old body, with each step you take, your hips sway side to side in an alluring fashion. Speaking which, you don't seem to have much trouble walking in heels as you make your way downstairs to the card store. You run down the stairs and out the door to find your uncle already in the van waiting. As well as that you see the rest of your team here, and right off the bat Kamui, the youngest of the group, was already arguing with Kai, who was not interested in dealing with him. "U-uh, a little bit..." the boy responds. You put a hand on your hip in a feminine stance and brush your hair out of your face with the other. He wasn't very good at taking directions, but at the very least through this you weren't making it obvious that you weren't suppose to be Misaki. The smooth feeling of your legs while you walked was also strangely pleasant, and since the weather was hot, having your legs bare and midriff exposed, it was a lot less stuffy than anything in your usual wardrobe. A cool breeze blows as you reach the stadium and you use your hand to daintily tuck your hair behind your ear.

As you enter the lobby you notice two familiar faces from the TV show. The first was that of the Palemoon user who was Misaki's rival in the show, and the other was the woman known as the "Empress". A strange feeling wells up inside you and you suddenly have a strong desire to best them in the tournament, but your thoughts are quickly interrupted as you are ushered away by the your uncle, the manager, to register for the tournament.

As you wait you let your mind wonder and as this happens you begin to think about other things.

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
Your thoughts drift to Sendou Emi, the younger sister of the protagonist of "Cardfight!! Vanguard" and the moment you think this, you start to feel a little bit drowsy. You sway back and forth, moving towards your bed, but black out before you reach it.

Slowly you come back into consciousness fluttering your eyes open. Before even moving you feel that something is off, you feel a little bit different. Ignoring the strange feelings for the moment, you dart your eyes left and right to survey your surroundings. The room looks very organised (more so than your own anyways) and as you look around it appears to belong to a young girl. The stuffed animals on the bed and hair accessories at the vanity tipped you off more than anything. You turn your head slowly to the side to get a better look at where you are when some orange hair falls into your view. "I don't remember my hair being this long..." you think to yourself, brushing it aside. You slowly sit up on the bed, the feeling of something brushing the back of your neck confirming that the longer hair you saw was not your imagination. Swinging your legs around you hop off of the bed, strangely finding your legs being just short of touching the ground while you were in a seated position on the side of the bed. While you stand there you notice that you seem to come up shorter against not only the bed, but also the table, chair and other furniture. Hesitantly, you take several small steps towards the vanity, hoping to make sense of what was happening to you.

Looking into the mirror of the vanity you are met with a familiar reflection, "Hey it's Emi from Va-" you quickly grab your throat shocked at the sweet voice of a little girl that came from your mouth. At the same time you notice the image of Emi in the mirror, copying your every action. Taking a deep breath you take another step towards the mirror and put your hand to your face, watching your new reflection follow you. The girl in the mirror was wearing the pyjama's of a young girl, with orange hair cut at her neck, a little messy from having just woken up in the morning. This young girl was now who you are, you have become Sendou Emi.

While you stare in shock at your new form, an absentminded thought passes your mind, "It's a school day today, I better get dressed..." you quickly move towards the wardrobe and take out the navy blue uniform of the private all-girls school in the neighbourhood. You take off your night clothes, and set it aside neatly. Putting on a pair of panties, a training bra and then slipping into the school uniform that you just pulled out. After this was done you took a brush and started carefully brushing your hair, looking carefully into the mirror to make sure you looked your best. Finally you take the hat that came complete with the uniform and stare into the mirror, now dressed in your uniform. Quickly you realised what just happened "Woah... I kind of, acted strange just then..." you say, finally realising that you are starting to act like Emi! Another urge washed over you, "Ah, I better wake up my Brother or he'll be late for school!"

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
Unable to stop yourself you run out of your room, after all you can't just let your big brother Aichi sleep in on a school day. As you run towards Aichi's room you take notice of how foreign your body is. The feeling of your hair brushing against you face was different and not only that, but because of how much smaller you body is, everything around you seems a little bigger and it takes you a while longer to run a distance than in your usual body. As well as that, this was your first experience wearing a skirt and the school uniform gave your now young hairless legs more room to breath. Running towards the room, the feeling of the uniform's skirt swaying around and brushing against your legs was a new feeling, yet strangely felt familiar and right.

Finally reaching your brother's you open the door and find him sleeping still. You find yourself sighing as you move towards the blanketed figure and begin shaking him, "Aichi! Wake up! You're going to be late for school!" you nag, continuing to shake him. The shape of your brothers body under the sheets begins the squirm, "Geez, if I have to wake you up every morning, what are you going to do when I'm not there..." those words of frustration seemed to spill out of your mouth naturally, as if caused by several years of frustration. The blue hair older brother finally managed to wake up. Rubbing his eyes he sits up and looks at you.

"Ah, Sorry for making you wake me up all the time Emi..." he said, drowsily staring at you. "You really are a good little sister..." the blue haired boy reached his hand out to you and patted you on the head. At first you wanted to reject this and slap his hand away, but strange feeling within you were actually making you like this. Blushing you spit out your last words to your brother before leaving, "W-well, breakfast is ready so come downstairs when you're done..."

Finally out of the room you find yourself able to think straight again, "Ah... what's happening to me, I'm acting just like Emi does in the show.." you shake your head trying to come up with why you were like this when the answer finally comes to you, "Right, the dream, that device..." you say, still not use to the high pitched voice you now spoke in.

"Emi, come down and have breakfast!" says a woman's voice from downstairs. You decide to wait until after breakfast to think up a strategy on how to fix this situation you got yourself into. Running downstairs, you are still distracted by the wrong signals your body was sending you. Being smaller and now wearing female clothing, your muscle memory of your old body was only aiding in confusing you further. Finally reaching downstairs you eat your breakfast promptly and move out the door, of course not forgetting your lunch. As you step out of the door the strange urge begins to affect you again, "I need to meet up with Erika-chan and go to school".

You struggle to maintain control over yourself, "I-I need to figure out how to stop this though..."

You start to think about the Red Saber from Fate/Extra Nero. You were always a big fan of her character, her design was beautiful and her rather upbeat, haughty personality added a lot to her charm. As you start on this train of though, the device begins to rumble and shine brightly. As the light overcame you, your vision slowly faded away into unconsciousness.

As you awoke you found yourself in what appeared to be a school classroom. There was nothing particularly note worthy about it but it seemed like a pretty typical classroom you'd find in any kind of school life anime. As turned to look around the room, a lock of hair brushed the side of your cheek and instinctively you brushed it away, only to notice the rather loose red sleeves that adorned your wrists. Inspecting this anomaly, it was now brought to your attention how odd your hands look. They were a lot more dainty, with long slender fingers and nails trimmed in an undoubtedly feminine manner. As you looked down your were greeted with an unfamiliar sight, a mountain of cleavage contained by a sheer white material, though not so much as to completely cover them as it showed a generous amount of your new womanhood. Beyond the torso, it appeared the garment you wore was a dress, mostly a red colour that hugged your hourglass form tightly, billowing outward at the hips.

You spot a full length mirror in the corner of the room and quickly walk over to it in an effort to get a better look at your new form, though given the evidence you were presented with, you felt you had an idea of what exactly happened. Yours steps were rather unsteady at first as it was difficult not only to adjust your balance with these new proportions, but you had to take smaller steps due to the heeled boots that you now wore over your feet. As you reach the mirror you're greeted with a familiar face. It was a beautiful woman by anyones standards, dressed in a rose coloured, military styles dress, her feet and legs clad long armoured, yet high heeled boots. She had green eyes and blonde hair that as that as tied at the back by a red ribbon into a tasteful bun. One detail about her attire you noticed was that the fabric at the front part of her dress was transparent, giving a free view of her underwear, and as a result, lack of manhood. Looking down you pat your crotch to confirm, finding that it wasn't just an illusion. This woman you saw in the mirror was now you. The device had actually worked, you have become Red Saber from Fate/Extra.

Yet as you occupied the body of a character you liked, maybe had lusted over though you hated to admit it, you felt no such feeling as you were now. In fact as you looked at the body in the mirror, an odd sense of pride filled you. An all too familiar haughty grin made it's way onto your face as you delighted in your own greatness. As you thought back on your strange dream last night, you couldn't help but wonder if it was something that could actually happen. Turning into a fictional woman? It sounded ridiculous, but you had a sliver of hope that something that ridiculous could actually happen to you. You consciously begin to fantasize about Balalaika, the mafia boss from Black Lagoon as your vision begins to fade to black. An empty void paradoxically fills your senses.

After what felt like several minutes of floating in space, your senses begin to kick back in. You can feel a slight breeze coming from your left, the cool air a bit refreshing after being in that void. You can hear incomprehensible chatter nearby, and a distinct smell of smoke. Your vision is the last to show up, as you look around to see that you're in a dimly lit office. An cold air is coming from a window to your left and a door is straight ahead. You're sitting in a comfortable office chair with a desk in front of you, seemingly with a bit more cushion than you're used to. You notice that you're in the office alone, and that the chatter that you were just hearing was coming from behind the door.

"Oh my!" You look down at your body and gasp as you realize that you're not yourself! Your voice surprises you as it's now deep and husky, yet feminine. You have deep, creamy white cleavage with what look like burn scars scattered all over your chest. The red skirt-suit that you're now wearing is not doing much to cover them up. You can feel pantyhose covering your long, supple legs and can hear high heels clicking against the hard floor beneath them as you tap your feet in excitement.

You don't have to wrack your mind to quickly realize who you are now. "I'm Balalaika!" You swiftly grab your large breasts with your new manicured hands. "Ahn~!" You cover your mouth in surprise and let out an uncharacteristic giggle, the sensitivity of them completely taking you off guard. Who knew being a girl would be this different! Everything feels so unfamiliar, but not in a bad way. You get up and push the expensive office chair behind you, your newfound height giving you a bit of vertigo. The heels immediately give you trouble, as your balance begins to waver and you have to grab onto the desk in front of you for support.

"Whoa, it's hard to even stand in these things. Mm, and I'm still not used to my voice. This is going to take some getting used to..." You guide yourself around the desk in your cumbersome heels, and brush your hand up against an ashtray. "Oh, that must be what that smell was coming from." Resting in it is a freshly lit cigar, it's smoke lazily flowing up into the air, giving the entire room an atmosphere similar to some sort of Noire-esque film. Your thoughts go back to Balalaika in all of her glory in the anime, and how intimidating yet sexy she is with a cigar in her mouth. The thought of emulating her crossed your mind. It's also completely possible that the dream you had wasn't just your own. What if it happened to other people? And what if they're not as average as you? You start to wonder if this was the best choice of woman to swap with. Maybe you should have gone for a setting less treacherous...

There's another knock, a bit more forceful this time. "Captain?" You can tell from the tone of the man's voice that he's starting to get a bit concerned.

You shake your head and clear your throat. "Yes, let them in."

The door opens as you stand up as straight as you can, the wobbling in your heels attempting to get the better of you. A lightly tanned woman dressed in a tank-top and daisy-dukes saunters into the office, her dark brown ponytail swaying in tandem. The large tribal tattoo on her arm gives her away immediately. You recognize her as none other than Revy, the main woman of the show! "Hey Sis! What's up?" She leisurely kicks the door behind her, the door coming to a loud slam.

You're screwed, realize. There's no way you could act your way through this, especially not with someone like Revy! She'd immediately find out something was wrong, though to not say anything at all would just be digging your grave. Maybe even literally! You swallow and lick your dry, yet puffy lips, a bead of sweat begins to form on your temple. "...I could ask the same of you. W-What are you doing here?"

Revy gives you a quick, lightly confused look, but brushes it off and jumps onto your desk. "I just wanted to drop by and see if you had any new jobs for me. Money's been real low lately, and it's not like booze and cigs are gonna pay for themselves, ya know!"

Your nerves calm slightly. She didn't seem to notice from the look of things. You cross your arms. "Not at the moment. There's been a bit of a... g-gap in our clientele recently."

Revy gives you another confused expression, her eyebrow raises. "Is that so?" She jumps off of your desk, "Well, that sucks. Now I've gotta settle with some shitty odd-job that doesn't pay half of what you and Hotel Moscow do. Goodbye wonderful, wonderful booze." She wipes a fake tear from her eye and head towards the door. "Anyway, I'll see ya later, Sis. Me and Rock've got some errands to run, and I'm sure you're a wooonderfully busy woman so I won't keep ya. Have fun!" She strides out the door as confidently as she came in and closes it behind her.

You're happy you managed to interact with someone like her without completely blowing it, but why did she say 'have fun?'" That seemed odd. Regardless, you let out the world's largest sigh and begin walking over to the desk, but not before tripping over your heels and practically toppling onto the hard floor, your tight skirt not doing you any favors either in getting around. "Owowow! Sheesh! There's no way I can keep this up at this rate. Something has gotta change."

You slowly stand up and vault into the steady, safe office chair. "Now let's see..."
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Let the guest in

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
"Now what do we have in here?" You roll back in the chair slightly and slide the first drawer out. Nothing. Second drawer. Nothing. Side drawer #1. Nothing. Does this woman not own anything? You seemingly speak too soon, as you begin to open side drawer #2 before immediately covering your mouth in shock. A gun! You don't know what you expected to find, but there's a difference between seeing a gun in a movie or show and seeing one right in front of your eyes, and this gun was definitely not a prop. You swiftly slide the drawer back into the desk and take a deep, yet shaky breath. You attempt to ground yourself. Seeing the gun has definitely put things into perspective for you.

First off, this definitely isn't a dream, and you're in the body of one of the most dangerous women in Roanapur. Tripping in your heels, stuttering, and acting like your goofy (previous) self isn't going to do you any good. At worst, it could get you killed. You have no idea what would happen if you died in someone else's body, and you'd rather not find out. The problem is, you can't help it! That's just how you are, and unfortunately being in a different body doesn't seem to change that.

You get out of your mind and glance down, noticing you've missed a drawer. Drawer #3. You shake your head and sigh, pulling it open. To your surprise, there's actually something in there. It looks to be a remote, though from scouting around the office, there wasn't any sort of TV anywhere nearby, so what could it be used for? You wrack your head and realize that you're a bit of a blockhead, as this looked exactly like the remote you dreamt about last night! It even had the same peculiar, notched knob on the side, with the strange symbol you've never seen before. You pick it up with your manicured fingers and place it on the desk in front of you.

There were no english letters, or numbers, or anything of that sort. Every button on this remote used unfamiliar symbols. The only thing that could possibly help you differentiate between them are the colors. A larger green button was placed in the middle of the remote, a red button to the left of that, and a blue to the right. Other smaller buttons were scattered throughout the rest in various colors, but these were the three that caught your eye. You find it curious that while this remote doesn't have any sort of language you understand or numbers, that it did seem to have basic colors. You tap your temple in contemplation. What's the worst that could happen if you pressed one of these buttons? Anything has to be better than the circumstance you're in right now, right? It's only a matter of time before someone begins to figure things out. And you can't stay in this office forever, of course. Maybe one of them could even transport you out of here! Out of desperation and a little bit of curiosity, you bite your plump lip and press...
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Dawn of the desk... drawers

choices: Quickly, she might figure out something! Get back inside her stat!
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
Your finger, long and feminine, slowly presses down and you hear the slight click of the feedback telling you it was pressed. All of a sudden, you feel a pull. Deep in your chest, as if it were tugging at your very heart... Or soul. You heard your lips let out a soft groan of pain as you feel as though your very essence was in the process of being split in half. With slow and groggy movements, you try your best to stand up and stumble once more, seeming as if you're drunk. An amusing concept considering the nationality of your stolen body.

With slow and clumsy movements, most of it falling and rightening yourself, you make your way through a nearby door and see what you're looking for; the bathroom. Deep in your stomach, you feel sick. As if your body was rejecting some kind of poison from its system. Your heels make it hard, especially on tiles and you fall to the floor, trying to use your military grade body to crawl the rest of the way but find its too late. Slowly you push yourself onto your knees and start to wretch, your body's muscles starting to shift involuntarily.

Then you vomit.

But it wasn't what you expected. Your soul is forced through Balalaika's body's throat and out of her mouth, the whispy blue essence spilling out like liquid onto the floor before it slowly starts to build up in a pile before moulding itself into the shape of your former body except made out of a mass of misty,milky, opaque smoke that seems to ripple and shift slightly with every small bit of air that hits it, meaning that the world could interact with you in your spirit's form.

Suddenly you hear a groan and look down to see Balalaika slowly rising to her feet, able to do it with shocking ease considering the struggle you went through just to walk or even stand. You couldn't help but feel a slight pang of jealousy. But then you saw the look on her face. Angry, hateful and filled with spite. She slowly looks at you but something seems off and you can’t quite tell if she’s looking at you or through you… But you had to act before you found out!
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: The green button

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
Immediately after you press it you look down and notice that the colors of the three main buttons were changing. Surprised but not completely thrown off by this, you see that the green button changes to orange, red to purple, and blue to yellow.

Could these new colors give the buttons different effects? Your peaking curiosity gets the better of you and you can't help but press...
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: The red button

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
As your finger depresses the bright orange button you immediately feel dizzy and unconsciously rest your feminine hand on the desk beside you. Your vision begins to tunnel as things become less and less fuzzy to you, your mind more and more distant. Your heart is beating increasingly fast until... not at all. All you see is a pitch black void. It feels similar to your previous encounter with this black void, but your senses begin to kick in fairly quickly this time around. Already getting used to these crazy, dream-like events, you thought.

As your senses return to you, the sun beams across your face unexpectedly. You cover your eyes instinctively and rub them as if you've just woken up from a nap. You look around at the pale buildings before you, wondering how you ended up out here. All different types of people are walking past you with no hesitation and practically no courtesy at all. You sigh and realize that you're definitely still in Roanapur all right. In that case, was the button some sort of teleportation technology? You look down at your body to still make sure you're Bala-

"Shit!" You yell out, a rough, husky voice coming from your throat instead of the one you had just a few moments ago. You look down into your tanned, perky cleavage covered by a tight black tank-top. There's a large tribal tattoo on your right arm too, and that was what immediately gave it away.

"I'm Revy!" You yell again, unable to keep your voice down as a few people look your way in surprise. "I'm Revy...!" You say again, a little quieter this time. That remote is unbelievable, you thought! To have so many options, so many possibilities... You can have a lot of fun with this!

And then you realize...

The remote is still in Balalaika's office.
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Change in perspective

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
You press the blue button, and it goes down with a satisfying click. You expect to go back into the void again, or maybe grow some gigantic breasts, you chuckle as you look down at your creamy cleavage. That'll never get old, at least.

...

Instead, nothing. Bummer. You look on the back of the remote and check for any sort of compartment. Aliens use batteries, right? Or maybe it's just a dead button? You sigh and place it back into the drawer for safe keeping. You assume no one but you is going to be entering this office without permission, so it seems like the safest place for it at the moment. Now that the drawer search has ended, you're clueless on what to do next. At first.

You look down at your breasts again, the cleavage almost hypnotic, the slight scars peaking out of the sides only enticing you further. Even with your female body, you still have a male brain, and it's starting to go crazy. You're impressed by how well behaved you've been since the swap, but you do reassure yourself that a lot has happened. You sensually begin rubbing your nylon encased thighs, the sheer difference of Balalaika's thighs compared to your own catching you off guard. They're large, supple, and strong. Even just touching them through the nylon you can tell they're used for more than just walking. You turn a hand to your breasts again, squeezing a breast through your suit. You knead it with your long, manicured fingers and relish in how soft and jiggly the top of it is. It feels so odd, too. So unlike your average male body.

You move down to your hips, and notice how wide they are. It's a true hourglass figure, and you can't help but explore every inch of them. You begin unbuttoning your top, each button undone building your anticipation. You slip it off, placing it in front of you. You look down again to see that underneath it is a white blouse that does absolutely nothing to hide your large breasts. They look even bigger without it, and you can now see the peak of a lacy bra behind it. You blush and go for another grope.

I have better things to do.

You furrow your brow in confusion, as that thought seemingly came out of nowhere. Why would you be doing anything else? Doing anything else could blow your cover, and at worst it could be extremely dangerous! Staying in the office seems like the best choice to you, so why not have a little fun? You might never get a chance like this again! You take your hands down to your thighs again to pull off your nylon thigh highs.

I need to start preparing for the next mission briefing.

Your eyes widen as you realize that's definitely not something you'd think about! You instinctively look down at the drawer with the remote. Did that thing do something to your thoughts? You pull it out of the drawer again and look at the blue button's symbol more closely. It looks almost like a brain, though not a human one. You can only assume that it actually did something! Though, in what way? Did it just mess with your thoughts?

Confused yet a bit excited, you decide to get some fresh air and step in front of the nearby window, resting your forearms on the sill. You didn't even realize that you had absolutely no trouble walking in the heels, but that didn't cross your mind at all.
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Going exploring

choices: Skip it and stay in the office
Go take a relaxing bath instead
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
You look down at the city, it looking to be around mid-afternoon. The ocean was clearly visible from the window, the sun reflecting on it's bright blue hue. People are walking the sidewalks down below, the cars are driving routinely through the streets. It strangely felt like another home to you, your other home being Russ-wait, that's not right, is it? Were you about to say Russia? Your home definitely isn't Russia. That remote is definitely doing something to your head, but you don't really seem to care all that much. It's strange, but not a bad feeling.

You look down at the streets below one last time and shut the window, closing the blinds behind them. Fresh air is nice, but you usually like your office a bit dark. You walk back over to your desk and take a seat, and as if on cue the phone in corner begins ringing.

About time Dutch calls.

You instinctively answer it and sure enough, it's Dutch. You effortlessly talk to him about an upcoming business deal between Hotel Moscow and The Lagoon Company, as if you've had these type of conversations dozens of times before. Your tone of voice throughout the phone call surprises you as well, it's deep and commanding, yet sultry. As the call finishes and you hang up, you're blown away by how simple it was. Not one topic in that entire conversation were you familiar with 5 minutes before, but you could feel the details of each one of them filling your head as you talked to him. You feel satisfied that things have gone according to plan.

You smirk and pick up the remote, twirling it around your fingers. You're confident that you're going to be able to deal with more circumstances than you were before, but you're still not completely confident. The effects of the remote must be gradual in some way, or maybe they're triggered by certain events.

You decide to test your theory out. You walk over to the guest chair beside the front door and pick up what looks like a folder full of documents. As you open it up and begin skimming through, you realize that a few of the pages are in Russian. Unable to read Russian, you curse under your breath. As you continue staring at the page in front of you however, it begins to make sense. It doesn't change to English, but you slowly but surely start to understand what's written. It's a manifest on recently ordered weapons for your men. You remember reading over it a few days ago, so you casually slip it into the folder and place it back down in the chair.

Enough of this. I need to get to the briefing room.

You didn't really prepare for any sort of briefing, but you somehow know that there's no need to worry. You reach for the door handle.
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Experiment

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
Before you leave, your curiosity gets the better of you. You turn back to the remote and walk over, nonchalantly pressing the red button. Its symbol looked like some sort of hand, but you were uncertain. Not noticing any immediate difference, you turn back around and head towards the door, opening it.

Looking to your right you see a guard resting his back along the wall. He immediately stands up straight and salutes towards you. "Captain," he says with a bit force behind his voice. You give him a nod and begin walking down the hall, unsure of where to go until the memory of the briefing room and its location fills your head. You walk the unfamiliar, yet strangely familiar halls and you come across several rooms before coming to the briefing room door. The signs beside the doors are all in Russian, but you're easily able to understand them. It's your mother tongue, after all. A brief feeling of anxiety travels to the pit of your stomach.

Fear is for the weak.

You take a deep breath and shrug it off, opening the door in front of you. What lies in wait is a very large meeting table with soldiers lining every available space around it. They hastily stand and salute you, you can feel their respect emanating from the way they present themselves. You attempt to confidently walk over to the empty chair at the end as everyone stares at you. You struggle to carry yourself the way you usually see Balalaika carry herself, but you push forward and by the time you make it to your chair, you feel like things are completely normal. You motion everyone to sit as you sit down yourself. Placed on the desk in front of you is a pile of documents, an ashtray, and an unlit cigar. Your men look at you expectantly.
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Go to the briefing

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
You instinctively cross your long legs, the nylon encasing them rubbing against one another. You rest your elbows on the table, putting your hands in a steeple in front of you. Your soldiers are waiting patiently as you look around at each one of them, your cold, intimidating eyes surveying their faces before speaking.

You lean back slightly. "You've all read up on the upcoming mission, yes?" Extended silence. You narrow your eyes, some of your men getting visibly worried. "Don't make me repeat myself." Your voice is forceful, yet calm.

After a few more moments of silence, a courageous soul speaks up. "C-Captain, that's what this mission briefing is for. We have no information yet." You curse yourself. The memories must not have triggered yet. You regret not preparing for the briefing earlier, but a feeling in your gut is telling you there's no need to worry. These are good men.

You bust out in a chilling laughter. "Well of course, Private. Am I not allowed to have a joke? Relax yourselves." There are a few chuckles, and the atmosphere calms down a bit. "Boris, give them the rundown if you would." Boris, your comrade and second-in-command, nods to you and stands up, his stony expression giving off a sense of authority just as you do. The scar going diagonally down his face also seems to give him an intimidation factor. Boris begins the briefing, as you continue sitting with your legs crossed and watching.

You begin to have an urge for something deep in your mind, but you're unsure of what. As Boris continues to talk, you look down at the table, and glance at the cigar again. Your heart skips a beat as you realize immediately what you've been missing. You pick it up with your manicured fingers, the texture unlike anything you've ever felt before, but very quickly it becomes something you're undoubtedly used to. You place it in the side of your mouth, and the man sitting across from Boris hastily reaches over with a lighter and lights it for you. You attempt a smile at him and take a long drag, inhale, then exhale the smoke past your lips with no issue at all, despite never having smoked in your life. You feel more powerful and more at home than you've ever felt since switching with Balalaika. You're finally getting the hang of things, thanks to that remote.

"...And that's all." Boris looks down at you and gives a final nod before sitting back down. You nod back and stand up, cigar still between your lips.

"Good work, Boris. That will be all for today, уволенный.(dismissed)" You're slightly surprised by the Russian you suddenly blurt out, but you keep a hardened exterior as smoke drifts up towards the ceiling. Your men promptly rise from their seats and start shuffling out of the briefing room. Very quickly, you and Boris are the only ones left.
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Rolling with it

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
You decide to leave for now, your interest beginning to drift elsewhere. You nod to Boris, looking in his eyes. Memories of your past, Balalaika's past begin to fill your head.

...Refugee camp

...Torture

Death

Boris somehow must have triggered them! They're painful, mentally and physically to you, the scar on your face beginning to pulse with your heartbeat. You shrug it off as best you can, but the sweat that begins to build on your forehead doesn't hide it very well. You grimace and glance at Boris, his face showing concern and compassion. He rests a large hand on your shoulder. The pain subsides. You remember something similar happening like this before, and Boris reacting more or less the same way. He's a quiet man most of the time, but a loyal one. You'd find him quiet charming if he wasn't your second-in-command. He really does seem to care for you, in his own way.

You smile at him in reassurance and nod, turning to leave.

He speaks up. "Don't work yourself too hard, Captain."

You turn your head slightly and smirk. "Don't get soft on me, Sergeant. I'm alright. Get back to work." You open the door and step out into the hallway, taking a long drag from your cigar. Exhaling the smoke towards the ceiling, you begin walking through the halls towards the exit. You felt like you were missing something however, so you decided to stop by your office. You look around for something, despite not knowing what you were looking for. You glance towards the wall furthest from you and instantly know as you see it hanging from a hook. Your military coat. You walk over and place it over your shoulders, it's comforting weight giving you a sense of warmth and complacence.

You head back out and walk towards the exit, taking occasional puffs off of your cigar. It's bizarre how quickly you've gotten so used to smoking, but now it just seems so... normal. Like an old habit you've longingly missed. You strut out of the front door, the bright evening sun of Roanapur blinding you temporarily. You look up at the sky dotted with the occasional cloud and muster a smile.

You lean against a lone iron railing bordering Hotel Moscow, taking in the sunlight and livelihood of the civilians of this town you call home. Some of the people that pass give you a fleeting look, fear flashing on their faces. You follow them with your own cold and emotionless eyes, the occasional gust of wind blowing through your long blonde hair. It feels like the longer you're you... Balalaika you mean, the more detached you feel from these people. Like they have something you don't. Or maybe it's the opposite? Could it be that you have an insight into something they don't? You ponder to yourself and hope the gaps feel themselves in with time. You continue to watch these people and smoke, the sun beginning to set.
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Thoughts

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
As you lean on the rail, you hear a voice from behind. It's Boris again, a sense of slight urgency on his face. "Captain, we've caught word from The Lagoon Company. They seem to be having some issues... and they require our assistance."

You raise an eyebrow and sigh. How could those imbeciles get into trouble so quickly? You talked with Revy just a few hours ago, and she's already gotten into danger? Boris looks at you expectantly.

"What is it this time?" You ask, annoyance in your voice.

"Local thugs, from the sound of things. Took them by surprise. Rock and Revy are tied up in an abandoned building a few miles east from here."

You slowly stand up. "Get me a ride and a few men, if you would. We'll head over there now." From your memories, you recall a couple of local gangs that like to cause trouble around the area, but you remember taking care of them months ago. What's made them act now? And to have them target The Lagoon Company knowing that Hotel Moscow has backed them quite recently. How foolish. You see a limo pull up in front of you, the door being opened by Boris himself. You nod to him and slide inside. A few soldiers exit the building and enter with you, but further to the front of the vehicle. You instinctively wave to the drive as you manage a smile to Boris. His cold face gets further and further away as you go towards the conflict.

You remember there being a firearm underneath your seat as you pull it out with ease, it's luster almost mesmerizing. You've used this gun hundreds of times, it's condition still good as new. You have your gunsmith maintain it for you, you remember.

I've killed so many with this.

You grab your head, the scars beginning to pulse again. Without Boris here to calm you down you do your best, but it takes a while for the pain to subside. Not such a joyride, regrettably. You unconsciously slide the gun into the holster beside your bra, only just now realizing something like that was there. You think about having a relaxing evening in the bath when you get back to your office to take your mind off of it all.

"Captain, we're here." You hear one of the soldiers call out to you. You feel the limo coming to a stop as you look out the tinted window. A large building with broken and boarded up windows sits beside you. You take a deep breath as one of your men slowly opens your door.
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Mission

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
You get out of the limo, nodding in appreciation to the soldier. He reaches into a satchel strapped around his shoulder and pulls out a box of Russian cigars.

You give him a sarcastic smirk. "I see you've come prepared, soldier."

The soldier stutters, the contrast of your dead eyes with such a playful smile messing with his perception. "Y-Yes, captain. Take one if you w-would." You oblige and pick one out, putting it between your lips. He reveals a lighter, lighting it for you immediately. You stare at him for a few moments, his visage reminding of you of your old self. He looks down slightly, struggling to maintain eye contact due to your intimidating figure. You give him a light pat on the back as you motion your other men to follow close behind and head towards the front entrance of the abandoned building.

You aren't an idiot, however. You without a doubt expect some sort of trap, so you instruct the demolitions expert to give a quick scout of the front area. After a few moments he motions that the area is clear of any threat, so you and your men approach the front door of the building, checking the knob. Unlocked. You wait as they cautiously open it, your hand relaxed but ready to act on a moment's notice. Nothing. You all gently enter the interior, the only clear light being from the entrance door behind you. As you close it, the building instantly becomes misty and dim. This is largely in part of it being late evening. The sun has almost set on Roanapur.

You stop and take a slow drag off of your cigar. Your men go slightly on ahead. You know to trust your gut in circumstances such as these, and your gut is telling you the coast isn't clear just yet. As if on cue, a man bolts from a room to the left of you, gun in hand! Your right hand instinctually reaches for your own firearm, it's cold exterior rapidly wrapped between your fingers before...

Bang

The unknown assailant is yelling in pain, grasping at his leg. Your men in front of you quickly look behind them and begin rushing back. You raise a hand signalling them to hold their positions.

"Gaaah! You bitch!" You look down at his pathetic face and crouch down, casually flinging the gun from his hand and sliding it across the floor towards the entrance. Your cold eyes look into his before you grab him by the collar and yank him up from the ground.

"Now," your voice is gravelly and low "You're going to tell me ex-act-ly what I need to know. Do you understand?" You muster a devilish grin as he looks to you in fear and anger.
1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.title: Go in with your men

1152222222222222222222222222212221222222.content:
Looking out of the window, you murmur to yourself in Russian about how nice that day was and now that your Briefing was done and over with, you had at least a few free hours to yourself. And a walk though the streets of the former Triad territory that made up your domain sounded just perfect. Soon , you find yourself strolling through the base before coming out into an open compound area, filled with patrolling guards and workers doing their jobs. As you walk, they all stop and salute sharply to you before carrying on.

You had just reached the outer gate when you hear a shout from behind you. It's Boris. He quickly asks you about a body guard team to escort you on your daily walk, revealing that this wan't an uncommon thing for the Mafia Boss to do at this time of the day. You refused only to find a heavy metal object being thrust into your hand followed by Boris insisting you take it for protection. You instinctively know what it is, your Stechken, and slide it into the shoulder holster inside your wine red jacket before casually waving over your shoulder as you stroll out of the gates.

It doesn't take long for you to arrive in the main part of the city, the long roads making navigation nice and easy. you look around at the sun-bleached buildings, seeing numerous businesses, all of which pay you protection money, littering the sidewalk in the form of everything from blankets layed on floors with a few items placed on top to large buildings with reinforced doors, shatter-proof glass and iron bars over the windows. You take in a deep breath of the hot and slightly too dry air with a sigh as it warms your body slightly from within.

Suddenly, you hear a shout from behind you; "Die you commie bitch!" a local accent cries out from an alleyway about twenty meters behind you. With a single movement, you've turned to face your aggressor to see a bulky man dressed in a grubby white shirt with a beer-belly brandishing a firearm in one hand. Suddenly, you feeling something else take over, like some kind of instinct. You stare him down for a second as he fiddles with and then aims the weapon, giving you enough time to identify it as an American made Tec-9, 9×19mm Parabellum sub-machine gun.

Making a call, you stand your ground not even flinching as the man unleashes a two second long volley of bullets at you, draining the twenty round magazine. Small puffs of dirt spray up around you as you stand with steely resolve in your eyes, not even flinching as the lead meets the dirt road around you.

The the gun clicks empty. The man pulls the trigger two more times before looking between it and you in confusion and fear, clearly not having bought another magazine for the gun before attacking. With long, slow and deliberate movements, you reach into your jacket and withdraw a long cigar and a lighter. You pop the cigar into your mouth and light it up, slowly puffing on it before putting away your lighter and withdrawing the Stechken.

"I suggest you start running..." You say in a low, loud growling tone, the cigar still clenched in your teeth. The man drops the gun and turns tail, going as fast as his chubby legs could carry him down the straight road. You lower your hand to your side before slipping out of your shoes and adjusting your pose. Then you raise the gun in a single side arc, the wrist hanging limply until you straighten it as your arm levels out. With a manicured thumb, you pull back the hammer with a almost heavenly metallic click. You slowly line up the sights with the running man and squeeze the trigger once...

The gun explodes, fire dancing from it's barrel as the hammer strikes the firing pin, sending it into the back of the bullet shell, igniting the firing agent and turning it to gas in a micro-second. The force drives the small piece of metal down the grooved tube, making it rotate as it does. 1252322121.content:
The world spins and darkens. You momentarily black out. When you regain your senses, you feel the touch of cold air on your flesh, cold stone against your palms and fingers. The darkness remains, however, and when your eyes finally adjust, you suck in your breath in recognition of where you are.

The gloomy throne room of the Undercity surrounds you. Stark, austere, and utterly utilitarian, the trademarks of Forsaken architectural design abound, from the rough hewn-stone walls caked with dust, to the crumbling old pillars which seem to list sideways. You are deep underground in a place sunlight could never hope to reach, and the lanterns suspended from chandeliers above do a pitiful job of penetrating the ubiquitous dark.

But from what meager light there is, you can discern the shapes and contours of your body: slender arms, an impossibly thin waist, and two unfamiliar mounds on your chest. Shoulder-length hair, the color of ashes, falls across your face, and though you do not realize it, you see the world through eyes which burn red, as if aglow with blood and fire. You are on your back, a tattered cape splayed beneath you, and the rest of your body accoutered in dark leather armor—save your arms, upper chest, and midriff, which remain seductively exposed.

You are the Dark Lady, Sylvanas Windrunner, Queen of the Forsaken—and all around, the Queen’s attendants are crowding you, concerned for the safety of their fallen monarch. You glimpse white-faced banshees, putrescent abominations, bony hands offering to help you up… and in the back, his hulking, winged form towering above the rest, the Dreadlord Varimathras looks on with keen curiosity.

“Are you well, My Lady?” Varimathras intones.

“I—” you begin to say, then stop short at the pitch of your voice. Swallowing hard, you continue. “I am fine. What happened?”

“You collapsed suddenly, without provocation. I hope the Queen of the Forsaken is not troubled by some… weakness?”

Your mind is still muddled, but you realize he’s speaking on multiple levels. It was only through Sylvanas’ superior strength and ability that she was able to bind the Dreadlord to her will. Should he realize who you are, or that the powers of his master have dissipated…

Like it or not, you are Sylvanas, and you are caught in the middle of a dangerous political game.
1252322121.title: Yes

12523221212.content:
This place is horrible! It’s too much to bear!

Your eyes fall upon the abomination, fat and grotesque, an undead monstrosity made of sewn-together corpses. There isn’t a single thing about it that isn’t horrifying—the way its left eye dangles by the optic nerve, or the way a third arm juts from the back of its neck, or how its guts are torn open, its stomach cavity exposed, its intestines unraveled and free to drag on the floor between its legs like an ungodly tail! With each lumbering step, it leaks a trail of blood and pus. The stench is overpowering! And God, the sounds it makes, a-gurgling and a-groaning and the buzzing of flies!

You feel the bile rising in the back of your throat and the iron vise of fear around your heart. Frightened, you scramble away on all fours, desperate to get away from that—that thing. Your back presses against a pillar, and you realize you can go no farther; if you do, you’ll go tumbling fifteen feet off the raised dais.

Fortunately, the abomination stops. It looks perplexed. So does Varimathras.

Still the other denizens of the room crowd around you, insistent on attending to their queen. You squeeze your eyes shut, too overcome with fear to look at them.

“You are unwell, Lady Sylvanas. Perhaps you should retire to the privacy of your bedchambers,” Varimathras suggests.

“Yes,” you manage to utter between heaving breaths. “That sounds good.”

“I will escort you there, Dark Lady,” offers one of the royal guards. You nod gratefully, then fast look away when you realize he has no face.

With difficulty, you make your way past the murmuring crowd, down the steps, and out the door.

 
* * * * * * * * * *

 
Once you are gone, Varimathras ushers the abomination out of earshot and speaks in a low voice:

“Notify our Master of the Dark Lady’s condition. This may be the opportunity he’s been waiting for.”

The abomination gurgles an affirmative and waddles away. Varimathras strokes his chin thoughtfully and is about to depart—but before he does, he spies something strange out of the corner of his eye and kneels down to pick it up…
12523221212.title: Flee the throne room.  Look for safe refuge.

125232212121.content:
Down a crooked corridor and up a flight of stairs, past countless pairs of guards who bow low as you pass by, to a highly ornamented wooden door at the end of the hall. There your escort leaves you, with a humble “My Lady,” and a low bow of his own. Nervously, you essay the doorknob. Finding it unlocked, you slip inside.

The bedchambers take you by surprise. Far from the harsh discomfort you’ve come to associate with the Undercity, the room is lavishly decorated. The furnishings are exquisite, if not a little tacky; you wince at the vanity mirror set into a skull-shaped frame, and at the eight-legged bed which plainly resembles a spider. Opulent pictures and tapestries hang from mahogany walls, lighted by delicate chandeliers and tall candelabras. A balcony overlooks the bubbling green moat as it curves its circuitous route around the city.

You look into the mirror. Sylvanas Windrunner looks back, her peerless beauty unmarred by imperfections in the glass. This is who I am now, you realize with awe. This soft gray-blue skin, these full lips, these breasts…

Marveling, you take the soft mounds of flesh in your hands. They bounce slightly in their garment, a tasseled leather number which winds around your upper body like a brassiere. Curious, you search for a clasp to remove it…
125232212121.title: Continue to the bedchambers.

1252322121211.content:
“I hope I am not interrupting, My Lady,” the smooth voice of Varimathras projects from the door.

You wheel around, instinctively covering yourself—a needless gesture since you are still clothed, and one which seems to strike Varimathras as amusing. With a bellicose laugh, he takes a step forward, and you instinctively step back.

“Why do you retreat from me, Lady Sylvanas? Surely I do not intimidate you?”

“These are my private chambers,” you manage to choke out. “I want you to leave.”

“I don’t think so,” Varimathras smiles. He looks you up and down. You feel as though you are being sized up like a piece of meat.

He continues to advance, and still you recoil from him. Your back is to the wall now—there’s nowhere left to go.

Now he’s ten feet away; now he’s five; now there are only inches separating him from you. You look up at his leering horned face, scarcely able to conceal your terror.

“You are not yourself, Lady Sylvanas. I do not know what malady has overcome you. This morning you were fearless. Now you stand whimpering before me. Do not try to hide it. We of the Nathrezim are like bloodhounds. I can taste the fear as it oozes from your pores and drips down your skin, as well as every other…” He reaches out a clawed finger to stroke your delicate cheek. “…primal emotion.”

You tremble at the Dreadlord’s touch. “Please, Varimathras. You’re right. I’m not myself. Leave me. I need time alone to—”

“Tell me, what is this thing?” he interrupts, holding out something in his hand.

Recognition dawns on your face. The Device! Desperately, you lunge for it, only for him to lift it high out of reach.

“Let me have it, Varimathras! Please! I’m begging you—”

“The old Sylvanas would not have begged me for anything,” Varimathras notes smugly. “I will offer you a choice.”

“A choice?”

“You will serve me fully, faithfully, unquestioningly, and in every capacity. No longer will I be collared to your will or yoked to this pathetic mortal sphere. Instead, it is you who will wear the collar, you who will bear the yoke.”

A moment of silence passes between the two of you. Hopelessly, you ask, “What’s my other option?”

“There is no other option. That is all there is for you.”

“But you said I had a choice!”

“You do have a choice. You may accept, or you may decline. Either way, there is no other option for you.”

The Dreadlord leisurely tosses the Device up in the air and catches it.

“What do you choose?”
1252322121211.title: Unfriendly Interruptions

12523221212111.content:
“Very well,” you whisper quietly. “I accept.”

Varimathras laughs deeply. Then, to your horror, he squeezes the Device until it breaks! You watch in shock and dismay as the shattered pieces slip through his claws and land on the floor below. In a state of denial, you sink to your knees and grasp for the scattered parts, frantically trying to put them back together.

His strong hands wrap around your throat, depriving you of breath. Your feet leave the ground as he lifts you up and pushes you roughly against the wall. Lungs screaming for oxygen, you claw at his hands, but your slender fingers are no match for his iron grip. His face is so close to yours, you can hear him breathing, can taste the pungent aroma of his breath as it slides down your nasal cavity and settles on the back of your tongue. You kick out at him, but it’s no use. There is no escape.

“You have made a wise decision, Lady Sylvanas,” Varimathras smirks.

The next thing you know, you’re flying headlong through the air. You hit something soft—the bed?—but you pay it no mind as you gasp for air and massage your aching throat.

“Take off your clothes,” Varimathras snarls.

The command goes completely over your head—but only for a moment. “W-what?” you gasp.

“Did you not pledge to serve me in every capacity? You are MINE. OFF WITH YOUR CLOTHES!”

Before you can scamper away, his claws tear at you, shredding the armor and tasseled brassiere, raking the soft, exposed flesh of your breasts. A hiss of pain escapes from your lips, followed by shouts of protest when you look down and notice blood seeping from long furrows in your skin. Until now it hasn’t dawned on you what Varimathras intends, but as he rips off the rest of your armor, your cape, and your pants, leaving you utterly naked, his motives become terrifyingly clear.

“No…” you whimper. “NO!”

You spot his throbbing white member, an enormous demonic mass of pulsating veins and tiny barbs aimed squarely at your loins. It’s impossibly huge, ten inches at least, and the girth of it… You are momentarily reassured. There’s no way it can possibly fit—

Then he PLOWS you, his enormous penis penetrating you deeper than you could have imagined. You double over as he scrapes the back of your vaginal cavity, stimulating your cervix, eliciting a sensation half pain, half ecstasy. He’s… too… BIG! You feel like your pelvis is about to crack under the strain of it! And those barbs are setting you on FIRE!

“Stop! STOP!”

You rise up on your elbows to try to push him off, but he forces you back down. Then he pumps—in and out, in and out, in and out. With each mighty thrust, you gasp for air, feeling as if you’re about to be split in two!

“SCREAM FOR ME, LITTLE ELF!” Varimathras roars.

You scream. Whether from pain or from pleasure, you scream, and scream, and scream.

Finally, the demon comes inside you. You feel him shoot his load, an endless jet of something hot, like molten lead, so hot it burns and you scream even more. He comes for an eternity, until at last his semen bursts from your vagina and trickles down your legs in scalding rivulets. When he’s done, he pulls out of you—slowly, to make it hurt more.

“I hope you enjoyed that as much as I did,” he chuckles.

You don’t respond. You are too busy writhing on the bed, doubled over in anguish.

Varimathras leans down over you. You shudder involuntarily at his hot breath. “I can take your pain away,” he whispers silkily.

He picks you up ever-so gently—then smacks you so hard, you go flying. Your head cracks against something, and you collapse to the floor in a heap. As sweet, merciful unconsciousness whisks you away, you wonder if you made the right choice.
12523221212111.title: Accepting the Inevitable

125232212121111.content:
Days pass, and you are confined to the cages of the Apothecarium. It’s a dismal place, dark and dank and infested with all manner of vermin. You listen to the rats as they skulk about at night, scrabbling with each other over the corpse of a long-dead dwarf. It’s funny. There’s hardly anything left for them, the corpse having been picked clean by maggots, and yet those rats are still probably eating better than you are. After all, the guards don’t acknowledge your existence, much less bring you food or water. You live your life in absolute darkness and unbearable cold, curled up into a ball to save body warmth, surviving off the occasional flea or roach that wanders into your pen. Before long, you succumb to delirium brought on by acute dehydration and hypothermia.

Dreams and nightmares blend with reality as you succumb to varying states of awareness. One moment, you see yourself reunited with everyone you’ve ever known and loved. The next moment, they’ve been dissected, their body parts strewn, their blood splattered across the walls. Then an abomination strolls in, a patchwork of your friends and family, all of them cut up into little pieces and sewn together into a fat, evil monstrosity. Even in your delusions, Varimathras watches and laughs…

In a rare moment of lucidity, you realize you’re out of time. You are going to die soon. You will never again see the people you love, and they will never know what happened to you. No one will mourn your death—at least not in this horrid world. There will be no funeral, no burial. When you die, your body will be food for rats and maggots, and that will be the end of you.

Then something incredible happens (though as you lie there in a coma, slowly dying, you hardly have the mental faculties to realize it). There’s light—bright, warm, all-encompassing light. And there are hands which pick you up and nurse you gently, rocking you back and forth like a newborn babe. Then the hands bring something to your lips—water, sweet water! You drink deeply, as if your very life depended on it—for it surely does—and when you’ve drank all there is, the hands raise another full cup to your mouth. Strength is returning to your limbs. You reach up to grasp the cup and tilt it back, desperate for every drop. When you’ve swallowed the last of it, those hands are there again to offer you a third cup, which you greedily accept.

It slides down your throat like the sweetest nectar. Slowly, you regain your senses. Your eyes flutter open, and you look up into the kindly face of—

No, it can’t be…

“Varimathras…”

Tenderly, he runs his hands through your hair. “Sleep now, sweet Sylvanas. You have suffered enough. All will be better in the morning.”

You do as he says and close your eyes, reassured that everything will be alright…






You awake to a different world.

The aroma of burning incense tickles your nostrils and coaxes you out of a pleasant dream. You arouse to find yourself in the bedchambers, surrounded by soft, comfortable pillows, clothed in a white satin nightgown.

Softness. Comfort. Clothes. Such things seemed the tokens of another life when you lied naked on the cold, hard floor of that cage.

Could it be true? Was it Varimathras who rescued you from that despicable place?

“Lady Sylvanas, I see you are awake at last.” The demon’s voice causes you to jump. You hadn’t noticed him sitting at your bedside. “I am glad to see you well.”

Gently, he strokes your cheek. You shiver at his touch.

“I’m glad too, Varimathras,” you speak softly.

“I have ordered a feast prepared in your honor. It awaits us in the adjoining room. If you care to join me…?”

A feast in my honor?

You haven’t eaten in forever, and the mere mention of food reminds you of the burning pain in your stomach. Ravenous, you scramble out of bed—then nearly collapse as vertigo overcomes you. It seems you haven’t completely recovered from your stay in the Apothecarium. Varimathras catches you by the shoulders before your legs give out. You blush with embarrassment but accept his chivalrous offer to escort you to the table.

The sight of the feast is enough to make you drool. There’s roast ham, chicken, and beef, fresh baked bread, fried potatoes, corn on the cob, apples, bananas, grapes, cakes and pies, and decanters of red wine. Varimathras pulls out a chair for you to sit down. You tear into the food even before he takes his seat at the opposite end of the table. All manners are forgotten in deference to your aching hunger.

Varimathras withholds conversation until you have drank and eaten your fill. When you finally push back your plate with a satisfied smile, he solemnly meets your eyes and says:

“Lady Sylvanas, long have I admired you from afar. Even for a demon of the Burning Legion such as I, it is impossible to deny your beauty. It would be a crime for me to pledge myself to the destruction of this world and you with it. Please do not force me to make that choice. I know we have shared a checkered history. I beseech you to look beyond our miserable past and consider a glorious, unimaginable future. Lady Sylvanas, will you be my queen and assist me in ruling this land?”

There is a puff of pink smoke, and before you hovers a ruby engagement ring. You feel the breath go out of you as you gaze on it. There it floats, slowly spinning, a universe of possibilities reflected in the many-faceted red gemstone.
125232212121111.title: Love and Torment

1252322121211112.content:
The ruby ring twinkles like a cat’s eye in the night. There it floats, slowly spinning, a universe of possibilities reflected in the many-faceted red gemstone. Varimathras is offering you the world and more.

Yet at what cost? Your freedom? Your humanity? Is the ring a shining beacon of freedom at the end of a long, dark tunnel, or is it a worm on a hook?

“No. I can’t accept. I won’t accept.”

The demon’s eyes flash with anger. In a violent rage, he turns over the dining table as if it were nothing, assaulting your ears with the cacophony of clattering silver and shattering glass. His furious snarl rises above it. He’s stalking toward you now, each heavy footfall filling your heart with a new dread. Still you remain frozen to the spot, trembling in fear of Varimathras, in fear of the Apothecarium. As he strides inexorably closer, his mighty hooves collide with an overturned chair and punt it with incredible force. It whistles past your head, missing you by inches, arcs across the room and crashes into the wall, splintering into a thousand pieces. The next thing you know he’s beside you, powerful hands flexing around your throat. His breath is like a million ants crawling on your flesh.

You squeeze your eyes shut in abject terror, awaiting his wrath.

It never comes. With trepidation, you open one eye and are baffled to see him smiling at you.

“I will never hurt you, Sylvanas.”

“You already have,” you reply sadly.

“No. Don’t you see? Everything I have done, I have done out of love for you.”

He kisses you on the lips. Not a kiss of lust or insatiable desire, but a kiss of tender affection. You are too stunned to resist, and before you can verbalize any protest, he strolls silently out of the room, leaving you alone to your thoughts.

Several minutes pass. Disbelievingly, you touch your fingers to your lips. Love? Me? Impossible! He’s insane!

Suddenly, the door bursts open and five abominations file into the room. They circle around you, cutting off any route of escape. Then into the center of the circle steps the subject of so many of your nightmares in the bowels of the Apothecarium, a man quite possibly even horrifying than Varimathras himself. The color drains out of your face, and you begin to shake and tremble anew.

Grand Apothecary Putress.

“I hear you’ve been a naughty girl. We can fix that,” he grins wickedly.

“No,” you whimper. “Please. NO!”

The abominations seize you painfully by the arms and drag you down treacherous stairs and labyrinthine corridors, to an all too familiar dungeon, to an all too familiar cage. Elsewhere in the Royal Quarter, seated high on the throne of the Undercity, Varimathras listens with an evil smile as your screams grow faint in the distance.
1252322121211112.title: Repercussions

12523221212112.content:
“I’ll never bow to you,” you say as bravely as you can.

But there’s a tremble in your voice, plain as day. Varimathras laughs deeply. Then, to your horror, he squeezes the Device until it breaks! You watch in shock and dismay as the shattered pieces slip through his claws and land on the floor below. In a state of denial, you sink to your knees and grasp for the scattered parts, frantically trying to put them back together.

You feel the blow before you see it—the pain in your gut, the breath rushing out of your lungs, the sudden start as you’re hurled across the room, the sudden stop as you crash against the wall. You crumple to the ground, gasping for air and clutching your abdomen. Varimathras delivers another kick, and another, and another. You scream for help; you scream for mercy. As your bones break and your organs bruise, you scream for no other reason but to scream. And when the attack and the screaming finally cease, you’re in the corner of the room, curled into as tiny a ball as you can make yourself, body broken and bruised, face soaked with tears and blood, shaking uncontrollably, sobbing uncontrollably, clinging to consciousness by the thinnest thread.

You lapse in and out of consciousness for the next several days, but you’re awake when the abominations pick you up and carry you roughly down the stairs. They take you to the bowels of the Apothecarium, that sick den of depravity where the scientists conduct their gruesome experiments on live subjects. They toss you into a cage, and there you wither without food or water for days at a time. Your only escape from this earthly hell is in your dreams, but even this is robbed from you when Grand Apothecary Putress dubs you his primary test subject and introduces you to his prototype electroshock rod every time you’re close to nodding off.

As the weeks go by, you overhear rumors. It seems the rest of the world was caught by surprise when the Dreadlord Varimathras usurped the throne of the Undercity and immediately declared war on all living races of Azeroth. The blood elves of Quel’Thalas were quickly overrun, followed by the humans of Southshore. The dwarves were pushed back to Loch’Modan, but eventually managed to mount a counter-offensive across the Thandol Span, while the combined might of men and orcs rained hot death on the enemy from their zeppelin fortresses. None of them were prepared for the return of Kil’jaden through the Sunwell, who bore down the mortal races with all the fury of the Burning Legion and crushed them beneath his boot. From that point on, the war was swift and decisive. These days, there are few souls alive in the world who can hope to stand against Varimathras and his infernal masters.

Finally, the day of your execution arrives. They take you from your cage and drag you to the gas chamber, where they strap you to a chair and seal you in behind heavy iron doors. With a hiss, the gas floods into the room—the new plague, Forsaken Blight, ready at last. Through the window you see Varimathras, his face bright with glee and laughter. You hold your breath for as long as you can, but eventually you are forced to succumb. As your lungs and other vital organs are liquefied from the inside-out and your flesh slowly melts and pools around your feet, subjecting you to pain and agony beyond description, your last thought is of how badly you wish you could go back in time and accept the choice Varimathras so generously offered you.
12523221212112.title: The Decline of Life and Liberty
