Ted groggily reaches for his phone, the obnoxious, blaring alarm like nails on a chalkboard.

"Just thirty more minutes..." He groans as he turns it off and sits up in his bed. "I can't believe summer's already over. How did this even happen?" He gets up and begins his morning routine. Ted had only been living alone for a few weeks, and yet it feels like not even a day has passed since he moved country. See, Ted is an exchange student. For the foreseeable future he's going to be going to a nearby University to attend class. He's also a freshman, and a nervous one at that. Thoughts of getting to class late, making himself look like a fool, are common themes.

"At least I've got plenty of time before cla-" Ted looks at his phone again. His eyes go wide. "C-Crap! It's my first day, how can I wake up so late! What the hell!" He frantically pulls out a set of clothes and attempts to get dressed as quickly as possible, but Ted isn't a minuteman. As he's frantically wrapping up his morning preparations, he looks at the clock and sighs, defeat in his eyes.

"Should I even bother?"
1252322222222222211.title: Bayonetta

12523222222222222111.content:
"No, I've got to go. This is my chance to redeem myself!"

--

Ted takes a deep breath and walks into the Universities' main hall, it's large presence and echo almost overwhelming to him. Countless people are bustling through, busy with their own lives as Ted feels out of place with his. Ted regretted not being more outgoing in high-school and University felt like a fresh start to him, especially as an exchange student. No one knew him! He was free to be himself! However, that's easier said than done. He's already late for his first class, and it feels like things are going to exactly the same as they did in high-school.

"Hey, kid! Join our club!" Before he knew it, someone slapped a piece of paper to his chest. He nervously looked around for the perpetrator but they've seemingly disappeared into the crowd. He looks down at it, it's large, outrageous looking lettering peaking his curiosity.

'Join us as we uncover the mysteries of the world in room 301, every Monday in the library at 3PM! The Occult Club awaits!'

Maybe it was the the over the top presentation or the topic itself. Regardless, he was kind of interested.

"The Occult Club, huh?" Ted mumbles to himself.

From what he's heard, early on in the year, every club organizer is frantically trying to recruit as many freshman as humanly possible. No wonder that person was in such a hurry, he thought.

Despite skipping his first class since he was already extremely late, the rest of the day went by fairly okay. Sure, he didn't talk to anyone, but there were no major accidents or embarrassments, so he considered the day a success.

"Well, it's almost 3. Maybe I should go check out that club..." After a bit of searching, he ended up finding the library. Ted gingerly opens the double-doors of the library and walks into the lobby. Thousands of books climb the large walls all around him, and as large as the lobby was, he immediately feels a bit more comfortable. It was quiet, and he liked quiet.

He glances at the assistant sitting at the front desk and nods his head. He'd rather just find the room himself. He looks for a flight of stairs and quietly begins to climb, the carpet muffling his footsteps. As he gets to the third floor, the layout was immediately confusing to him. It was practically a maze! As he aimlessly wanders the floor, he notices a book lying on the ground in front of him. The shelf beside it was incredibly dusty, clearly being neglected for years at the earliest. He picks it up and flips it around, it's ornate design on the cover almost entrancing to his eye. He opens it up, flipping through the pages and immediately noticing that it wasn't in English. Ted wasn't fluent in any other language but English, but this definitely looked strange to him. It didn't look like any language that he'd seen before.

"What are you doing over there?"

Ted flung his head towards the voice as he unconsciously hid the book behind his back. "Uh, n-nothing! I'm uhm... just trying to find room 301."

The older woman smiles and points behind her. "Oh, well in that case, just go straight behind me and take left, that'll get you there. Sorry for startling you, young man." Ted nodded meekly and made sure she was gone before taking the book from behind his back. "Why did I even care to hide this thing? It's just an old book..." He looks down at it again. For some reason, the book feels immensely important to him. Like it was calling to him. He places it in his bag and begins walking towards the occult room.

Vade in cubiculum tuum

Ted tenses as he looks around in fear. "W-Who said that?"

Nothing. Was he imagining it?

For some reason, he has an overwhelming to leave and go back to his dorm room. It was almost like he didn't even have a choice in the matter. Like the voice was commanding him to do so.

As he closes his door behind him, he zips open his bag and pulls out the book, flinging his bag onto his bed.

"What the hell is up with this thing?" He asks rhetorically. He flips open the pages and comes across a page with a different layout than the rest. It feels different. It almost looks like a list. As he looks through them, he begins to read a line out loud.
